member.name: T:FolkerKinzel.VCards.AnsiFilter
member.summary: Helper class used to automatically detect and correctly load VCF files stored in a code page other than UTF-8.

remarks.para: VCF files of the vCard 2.1 standard were previously saved by Outlook and Outlook Express in the ANSI encoding of the current Windows system, without always encoding the extended characters with quoted printable encoding. In principle, VCF files of the vCard 3.0 standard can also be ANSI-encoded if, for example, they were transmitted in an e-mail that specified the encoding in its content header. UTF-8 encoding has only been mandatory since vCard 4.0.

This class is a wrapper around the method that initially loads the file as UTF-8. If a decoding error occurs, the method examines the objects for any (CHARSET) parameters, which provide an indication of the to be used. If a hint is found, the file is reloaded with the determined , otherwise with the specified in the constructor as a fallback.
(The CHARSET parameter exists only in the vCard 2.1 standard.)

example.note: To make the code more readable, exception handling has been omitted from the examples.

member.name: M:FolkerKinzel.VCards.AnsiFilter.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes an instance of the class with the number of the code page to use for the reading of VCF files that are not UTF-8 and that do not contain a hint in their CHARSET parameters which suggests the use of a different .
member.param: The number of the code page to use as a fallback. The default value is 1252 (for windows-1252).
member.exception: The number specified for could not be mapped to an ANSI code page.

member.name: M:FolkerKinzel.VCards.AnsiFilter.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes an instance of the class with the property of the object to use for reading VCF files that are not UTF-8 and that do not contain a hint in their CHARSET parameters which suggests the use of a different .
member.param: property of the object to use as a fallback.
member.exception: is null.
The identifier specified for could not be mapped to an ANSI code page.

member.name: P:FolkerKinzel.VCards.AnsiFilter.FallbackEncoding
member.summary: The object to use as fallback.

member.name: P:FolkerKinzel.VCards.AnsiFilter.UsedEncoding
member.summary: The used to read the VCF file.

member.name: M:FolkerKinzel.VCards.AnsiFilter.Load(System.String)
member.summary: Loads a VCF file and automatically selects the appropriate .
member.param: Absolute or relative path to a VCF file.
member.returns: A collection of parsed objects.
member.exception: is null.
is not a valid file path.
The file could not be loaded.

member.summary: INLINE: The location of the property value is inline with the property. (Default)

member.name: F:FolkerKinzel.VCards.Enums.Loc.Cid
member.summary: Content-ID, CID: In the case of the vCard being transported within a MIME e-mail message, the property value can be specified as being located in a separate MIME entity with the Content-ID value, or CID for short. In this case, the property value is the Content-ID for the MIME entity containing the property value.

member.name: F:FolkerKinzel.VCards.Enums.Loc.Url
member.summary: URL: The property value is specified as being located out on the network within some Internet resource. In this case, the property value is the Uniform Resource Locator for the Internet resource containing the property value.

member.name: T:FolkerKinzel.VCards.Enums.Rel
member.summary: Named constants to describe the type of relationship with a person or organization. The constants can be combined.

remarks.note: When working with the enum use the extension methods from the class.

member.name: F:FolkerKinzel.VCards.Enums.Rel.Contact
member.summary: contact: Someone you know how to get in touch with. Often symmetric.

member.name: F:FolkerKinzel.VCards.Enums.Rel.Acquaintance
member.summary: acquaintance: Someone who you have exchanged greetings and not much (if any) more maybe a short conversation or two. Often symmetric.

member.name: F:FolkerKinzel.VCards.Enums.Rel.Friend
member.summary: friend: Someone you are a friend to. A compatriot, buddy, home(boy|girl) that you know. Often symmetric.

member.name: F:FolkerKinzel.VCards.Enums.Rel.Met
member.summary: met: Someone who you have actually met in person. Symmetric.

member.name: F:FolkerKinzel.VCards.Enums.Rel.CoWorker
member.summary: co-worker: Someone a person works with, or works at the same organization as. Symmetric. Usually transitive.

member.name: F:FolkerKinzel.VCards.Enums.Rel.Colleague
member.summary: colleague: Someone in the same field of study/activity. Symmetric. Often transitive.

member.name: F:FolkerKinzel.VCards.Enums.Rel.CoResident
member.summary: co-resident: Someone you share a street address with. Symmetric and transitive.

member.name: F:FolkerKinzel.VCards.Enums.Rel.Neighbor
member.summary: neighbor: Someone who lives nearby, perhaps only at an adjacent street address or doorway. Symmetric. Often transitive.

member.name: F:FolkerKinzel.VCards.Enums.Rel.Child
member.summary: child: A person's genetic offspring, or someone that a person has adopted and takes care of. Inverse is parent.

member.name: F:FolkerKinzel.VCards.Enums.Rel.Parent
member.summary: parent: Elternteil: Das Gegenteil von .

member.name: F:FolkerKinzel.VCards.Enums.Rel.Sibling
member.summary: sibling: Someone a person shares a parent with. Symmetric. Usually transitive.

member.name: F:FolkerKinzel.VCards.Enums.Rel.Spouse
member.summary: spouse: Someone you are married to. Symmetric. Not transitive.

member.name: F:FolkerKinzel.VCards.Enums.Rel.Kin
member.summary: kin: A relative, someone you consider part of your extended family. Symmetric and typically transitive.

member.name: F:FolkerKinzel.VCards.Enums.Rel.Muse
member.summary: muse: Someone who brings you inspiration. No inverse.

member.name: F:FolkerKinzel.VCards.Enums.Rel.Crush
member.summary: crush: Someone you have a crush on. No inverse.

member.name: F:FolkerKinzel.VCards.Enums.Rel.Date
member.summary: date: Someone you are dating. Symmetric. Not transitive.

member.name: F:FolkerKinzel.VCards.Enums.Rel.Sweetheart
member.summary: sweetheart: Someone with whom you are intimate and at least somewhat committed, typically exclusively. Symmetric. Not transitive.

member.name: F:FolkerKinzel.VCards.Enums.Rel.Me
member.summary: me: A link to yourself at a different URL. Exclusive of all other XFN values. Required symmetric. There is an implicit "me" relation from the contents of a directory to the directory itself.

member.name: F:FolkerKinzel.VCards.Enums.Rel.Agent
member.summary: agent: An entity who may sometimes act on behalf of the entity associated with the vCard.

member.name: F:FolkerKinzel.VCards.Enums.Rel.Emergency
member.summary: emergency: Indicates an emergency contact.

member.name: T:FolkerKinzel.VCards.Enums.VcfOpts
member.summary: Named constants to specify options for writing VCF files. The constants can be combined.

remarks.note: When working with the enum use the extension methods from the class.
remarks.para: The flags , , , and control the automatic generation of objects. Even if these flags are set, the objects are only generated automatically, if the selected vCard standard does not allow a standardized equivalent.

member.name: F:FolkerKinzel.VCards.Enums.VcfOpts.All
member.summary: All flags are set.

member.name: F:FolkerKinzel.VCards.Enums.VcfOpts.None
member.summary: All flags are unset.

member.name: F:FolkerKinzel.VCards.Enums.VcfOpts.WriteGroups
member.summary: Set the flag to write property group identifiers.

member.name: F:FolkerKinzel.VCards.Enums.VcfOpts.WriteEmptyProperties
member.summary: Set the flag to also write empty properties to the vCard.

member.name: F:FolkerKinzel.VCards.Enums.VcfOpts.AppendAgentAsSeparateVCard
member.summary: Set the flag to append in vCard 2.1 and vCard 3.0 embedded AGENT-vCards in the VCF file to the main vCard.

member.name: F:FolkerKinzel.VCards.Enums.VcfOpts.WriteNonStandardParameters
member.summary: Set the flag to write non-standard parameters to the VCF file.

member.name: F:FolkerKinzel.VCards.Enums.VcfOpts.WriteNonStandardProperties
member.summary: Set the flag to write objects to the VCF file.

member.name: F:FolkerKinzel.VCards.Enums.VcfOpts.WriteRfc6474Extensions
member.summary: Set the flag to write the extensions from RFC 6474 (BIRTHPLACE, DEATHPLACE, DEATHDATE). (Beginning from vCard 4.0.)

member.name: F:FolkerKinzel.VCards.Enums.VcfOpts.WriteRfc6715Extensions
member.summary: Set the flag to write the extensions from RFC 6715 (EXPERTISE, HOBBY, INTEREST, ORG-DIRECTORY). (Beginning from vCard 4.0.)

member.name: F:FolkerKinzel.VCards.Enums.VcfOpts.WriteImppExtension
member.summary: Set the flag to write the extension IMPP from RFC 4770 in vCard 3.0.

member.name: F:FolkerKinzel.VCards.Enums.VcfOpts.WriteXExtensions
member.summary: Set the flag to write the following vCard properties (if necessary): X-AIM, X-GADUGADU, X-GOOGLE-TALK, X-GTALK, X-ICQ, X-JABBER, X-MSN, X-SKYPE, X-TWITTER, X-YAHOO, X-MS-IMADDRESS, X-GENDER, X-ANNIVERSARY, X-SPOUSE, X-SOCIALPROFILE, and the X-SERVICE-TYPE parameter.

member.name: F:FolkerKinzel.VCards.Enums.VcfOpts.WriteEvolutionExtensions
member.summary: Set the flag to write the following vCard properties if necessary: X-EVOLUTION-ANNIVERSARY, X-EVOLUTION-SPOUSE.

member.name: F:FolkerKinzel.VCards.Enums.VcfOpts.WriteKAddressbookExtensions
member.summary: Set the flag to write the following vCard properties if necessary: X-KADDRESSBOOK-X-IMAddress, X-KADDRESSBOOK-X-Anniversary, X-KADDRESSBOOK-X-SpouseName.

member.name: F:FolkerKinzel.VCards.Enums.VcfOpts.WriteWabExtensions
member.summary: Set the flag to write the following vCard properties if necessary: X-WAB-GENDER, X-WAB-WEDDING-ANNIVERSARY, X-WAB-SPOUSE-NAME.

member.name: F:FolkerKinzel.VCards.Enums.VcfOpts.AllowMultipleAdrAndLabelInVCard21
member.summary: Set the flag to allow multiple "ADR" and "LABEL" properties to be written into a vCard 2.1.

member.name: F:FolkerKinzel.VCards.Enums.VcfOpts.UpdateTimeStamp
member.summary: Set the flag to update the property automatically when serializing VCF.

member.name: F:FolkerKinzel.VCards.Enums.VcfOpts.SetPropertyIDs
member.summary: Set the flag to call automatically when serializing a as vCard 4.0 (or higher).

member.name: F:FolkerKinzel.VCards.Enums.VcfOpts.SetIndexes
member.summary: Set the flag to set the properties in all collections that contains more than one item automatically when serializing vCard 4.0 (or higher). The values depend on the positions of the objects in the collection and on the flag . Any previously existing values will be overwritten.

member.name: F:FolkerKinzel.VCards.Enums.VcfOpts.WriteRfc2739Extensions
member.summary: Set the flag to write the extensions from RFC 2739 (FBURL, CALURI, CALADRURI) in vCard 3.0.

member.name: F:FolkerKinzel.VCards.Enums.VcfOpts.WriteRfc8605Extensions
member.summary: Set the flag to write the extensions from RFC 8605 (FBURL, CONTACT-URI property, CC parameter) in vCard 4.0.

member.name: F:FolkerKinzel.VCards.Enums.VcfOpts.WriteRfc9554Extensions
member.summary: Set the flag to write the extensions from RFC 9554 in vCard 4.0.

member.name: F:FolkerKinzel.VCards.Enums.VcfOpts.WriteRfc9555Extensions
member.summary: Set the flag to write the extensions from RFC 9555 in vCard 4.0.

member.name: M:FolkerKinzel.VCards.Extensions.IEnumerableExtension.Reference(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{FolkerKinzel.VCards.VCard})
member.summary: Returns a collection of objects containing both the objects passed as a collection as well as those which had been embedded in their property. The previously embedded objects are now referenced by objects that are initialized with the value of the property of these previously embedded s.
member.param: A collection of objects. The collection may be empty or may contain null values.
member.returns: A collection of objects in which the objects previously embedded in the property are appended separately and referenced through their property. (If the appended objects did not already have a property, the method automatically assigns them a new one.)

remarks.note: Although the method itself is thread-safe, the objects passed to the method are not. Block read and write access to these objects, while this method is being executed!
Never use this method, if you want to save a VCF file as vCard 2.1 or vCard 3.0!
remarks.para: The method is - if necessary - automatically called by the serialization methods of . It only makes sense to use it in your own code if a object is to be saved as vCard 4.0, and if each VCF file should only contain a single vCard. (As a rule, this approach is not advantageous as it endangers referential integrity.)

example.para: The example demonstrates how a object can be saved as a vCard 4.0 if it is intended that a VCF file should only contain one single vCard. The example may also show that this approach is generally not advantageous, because it endangers referential integrity.
example.note: For the sake of easier readability, exception handling has not been used in the example.

member.exception: is null.

member.name: M:FolkerKinzel.VCards.Extensions.IEnumerableExtension.Dereference(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{FolkerKinzel.VCards.VCard})
member.summary: Replaces the instances that refer external vCards with their values by instances that contain these instances directly, provided that contains these instances.
member.param: A collection of objects. The collection may be empty or may contain null values.

remarks.para: The method is automatically called by the deserialization methods of the class. Using it in your own code can be useful, e.g., if objects from different sources are combined in a common list in order to make their data searchable.

example.para: The example shows the deserialization and analysis of a VCF file whose content refers to other VCF files.
example.note: For the sake of easier readability, exception handling has not been used in the example.

member.exception: is null.

member.name: M:FolkerKinzel.VCards.Intls.Extensions.StringBuilderExtension.AppendParameterValueEscapedV40(System.Text.StringBuilder,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Appends masked and quoted according to RFC 6868 and makes a special treatment for line breaks in LABEL parameters.
member.param: The .
The parameter value to append.
true if is the value of a LABEL parameter.
member.returns: A value that indicates whether the appended must be enclosed with double quotes.

remarks.para: RFC 6350 6.3.1 states that newlines in LABEL parameters "are encoded as \n, as they are for property values".
According to the suggestion in the StackOverflow question
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/20508633/how-to-encode-newlines-in-vcard-4-0-parameter-values-n-or-n
there is made a special treatment for newlines in LABEL parameters. Ev'rything else is encoded according to RFC 6868.

member.name: M:FolkerKinzel.VCards.Intls.Extensions.TimeZoneIDExtension.UtcOffsetRegex
member.remarks:
Pattern:
^[-\\+]?[01][0-9]:?([0-5][0-9])?
Options:
RegexOptions.CultureInvariant
Explanation:
Match if at the beginning of the string.
Match a character in the set [+-] atomically, optionally.
Match a character in the set [01].
Match a character in the set [0-9].
Match ':' greedily, optionally.
Optional (greedy).
1st capture group.
Match a character in the set [0-5].
Match a character in the set [0-9].

member.name: T:FolkerKinzel.VCards.ITimeZoneIDConverter
member.summary: Defines a method that converts a , which represents a named time zone (IANA time zone ID), into a corresponding UTC offset.

remarks.para: The vCard 4.0 standard recommends specifying time zones as IANA time zone names. - Older standards (vCard 2.1, vCard 3.0), however, prefer UTC offsets.

It is possible to convert IANA time zone names to UTC offsets, but it's not possible to convert UTC offsets to IANA time zone names because there is no unique assignment. Therefore it's recommended to initialize objects with IANA time zone names and then to convert these to UTC offsets using an implementation of when serializing a vCard 2.1 or a vCard 3.0.

Since .NET cannot do the conversion itself, this interface enables a 3rd-party library to be integrated. (Since .NET 6.0 exists a .NET solution with the ICU library but this needs a separate dependency or additional configuration.)

example.note: To make it easier to read, exception handling has been omitted in the following example.

member.name: M:FolkerKinzel.VCards.ITimeZoneIDConverter.TryConvertToUtcOffset(System.String,System.TimeSpan@)
member.summary: Tries to convert a , which represents a time zone name (IANA time zone ID), into a UTC offset belonging to this time zone.
member.param: A representing the name of a time zone.
Contains the UTC offset after the method has been successfully returned. The argument is passed uninitialized.
member.returns: true, if could be converted into a UTC offset, otherwise false.

note.para: The method should at least be able to convert IANA time zone IDs into UTC offsets. (You could also convert POSIX time zone identifiers, for example.) It makes sense to use a 3rd-party NuGet package for the task, as .NET is currently not able to do this itself.
It is not necessary for the method to convert s that already represent a UTC offset, since the library already does this itself.

member.value: This value is not restricted to numeric values and can include any value such as number ranges ("112-10"), grid style ("39.2 RD"), alphanumerics ("N6W23001"), or fractionals ("123 1/2").

member.remarks: The vCard 4.0 specification allows to omit the year in a date but the .NET data types don't. This property gets the information whether the year component of an encapsulated or value should be treated as irrelevant or not.

member.remarks: This parameter MAY be set on any where conveying authorship is desired. As an alternative or in addition to this parameter, the parameter allows identifying an author by .

member.name: P:FolkerKinzel.VCards.Models.Properties.Parameters.ParameterSection.Created
member.summary: CREATED: Defines the date and time when a was created. (4 - RFC 9554)
member.remarks: This parameter MAY be set on any to define the point in time when the property was created. Generally, updating a value SHOULD NOT change the creation timestamp.

member.name: P:FolkerKinzel.VCards.Models.Properties.Parameters.ParameterSection.Calendar
member.summary: CALSCALE: The calendar system in which a date or date-time value is expressed. (4)

value.para: A that specifies the calendar system. If none is specified, returns .
If you want to specify a CALSCALE parameter in the VCF file, pass a to this property, otherwise assign null to ensure that no CALSCALE parameter will be written.

member.name: P:FolkerKinzel.VCards.Models.Properties.Parameters.ParameterSection.CharSet
member.summary: CHARSET: Indicates the character set that was used for the property. (2)

member.name: P:FolkerKinzel.VCards.Models.Properties.Parameters.ParameterSection.ComponentOrder
member.summary: JSCOMPS: Defines the order and separators for the elements of a structured property value. (4 - RFC 9555)

remarks.para: The value facilitates converting name and address components between JSContact and vCard. It preserves the order of the components of the JSContact property and contains the verbatim values of separator components. (See RFC 9555 for details.)
This parameter can be used with the instances in and .

member.name: P:FolkerKinzel.VCards.Models.Properties.Parameters.ParameterSection.ContentLocation
member.summary: VALUE: Indicates where the actual content of the property is located. (2)

member.name: P:FolkerKinzel.VCards.Models.Properties.Parameters.ParameterSection.Context
member.summary: CONTEXT: Indicates the context of the data. (3)
member.value: VCARD or LDAP.
member.remarks: Is used in the SOURCE property of vCard 3.0.

member.name: P:FolkerKinzel.VCards.Models.Properties.Parameters.ParameterSection.CountryCode
member.summary: CC: ISO 3166 two-character country code. (4 - RFC 8605)

member.name: P:FolkerKinzel.VCards.Models.Properties.Parameters.ParameterSection.DataType
member.summary: VALUE: Indicates which of the data types predefined by the vCard standard the content of the vCard property corresponds to. (3,4)

member.name: P:FolkerKinzel.VCards.Models.Properties.Parameters.ParameterSection.Derived
member.summary: DERIVED: Specifies that the value of the associated is derived from some other values in the same . (4 - RFC 9554)

remarks.para: This property parameter SHOULD be specified on a if the property value is derived from some other properties in the same . When present with a value of true, clients MUST NOT update the .

As an example, an implementation may derive the value of the FN property from the name components of the N property. It indicates this fact by setting the DERIVED parameter on the FN property to "true".

member.name: P:FolkerKinzel.VCards.Models.Properties.Parameters.ParameterSection.EMailType

member.value: Use only the constants defined in the class!

member.summary: ENCODING: Indicates the encoding of the VCardProperty. (2,3)

value.para: The value is set automatically - only for objects this has to be done manually.

member.name: P:FolkerKinzel.VCards.Models.Properties.Parameters.ParameterSection.Index

member.name: P:FolkerKinzel.VCards.Models.Properties.Parameters.ParameterSection.InstantMessengerType

member.name: P:FolkerKinzel.VCards.Models.Properties.Parameters.ParameterSection.Interest

member.name: P:FolkerKinzel.VCards.Models.Properties.Parameters.ParameterSection.JSContactPointer
member.summary: JSPTR: This parameter is used with the instances in . Its value points to the JSContact property whose value is stored in the . (4 - RFC 9555)
member.value: A valid JSON pointer as defined in RFC 6901, or null.

member.name: P:FolkerKinzel.VCards.Models.Properties.Parameters.ParameterSection.Label
member.summary: LABEL: Represents the actual text that should be put on the mailing label, when delivering a physical package to the person/object associated with the . ([2],[3],4)

remarks.para: In the vCard standards 2.1 and 3.0, ADR and LABEL are separate vCard properties. Only as of vCard 4.0 they are permanently linked to one another. When saving a vCard 2.1 and vCard 3.0, the content of this property is automatically inserted into the vCard as a separate LABEL property. It's recommended in this case to assign a identifier to the : The LABEL property will get the same automatically.

note.para: When loading a vCard 2.1 or 3.0, the library tries to create the link between LABEL and ADR based on matching identifiers and parameters of both properties. A text comparison of the content of ADR and LABEL does not take place for performance reasons.

Although the correct assignment is usually successful in this way, this cannot be guaranteed for every scenario. If the assignment of ADR and LABEL plays an important role for the application, the application should check this in the case of vCard 2.1 or vCard 3.0 by text comparison or create its own labels from the data, e.g., using the class.

member.name: P:FolkerKinzel.VCards.Models.Properties.Parameters.ParameterSection.Language
member.summary: LANGUAGE: Language of the of the . (2,3,4)
member.value: An IETF Language Tag as defined in Section 2 of RFC 5646.

member.name: P:FolkerKinzel.VCards.Models.Properties.Parameters.ParameterSection.MediaType
member.summary: MEDIATYPE : Specifies the MIME type for the data to which a URI refers. (4)
member.value: Internet Media Type ("MIME type") according to RFC 2046.

member.name: P:FolkerKinzel.VCards.Models.Properties.Parameters.ParameterSection.NonStandard
member.summary: Non-standard attributes. (2,3,4)

remarks.para: In order to write non-standardized attributes into a VCF file, the VcfOptions.WriteNonStandardParameters flag must be set explicitly when serializing the object.
Don't use this property for X-SERVICE-TYPE. Use instead.

member.name: P:FolkerKinzel.VCards.Models.Properties.Parameters.ParameterSection.Phonetic
member.summary: PHONETIC: Defines how to pronounce the value of another property in the same vCard. (4 - RFC 9554)
member.value: The parameter value indicates the phonetic system.
member.remarks: This property parameter indicates that the value of its property contains the phonetic representation of another same-named property in the same vCard. Exemplary uses are defining how to pronounce Japanese names and romanizing Mandarin or Cantonese names and address components.

member.name: P:FolkerKinzel.VCards.Models.Properties.Parameters.ParameterSection.PhoneType
member.summary: TYPE: Describes a phone number. (2,3,4)

member.name: P:FolkerKinzel.VCards.Models.Properties.Parameters.ParameterSection.Preference
member.summary: PREF or TYPE=PREF: Expresses preference for a property. (2,3,4)
member.value: A value between 1 and 100. 1 means most preferred.
member.remarks: A differentiated preference can only be stated beginning with vCard 4.0. In vCard 2.1 and vCard 3.0 only the most preferred property is marked with PREF. As the preferred property the one is selected with the lowest numerical value for .

member.name: P:FolkerKinzel.VCards.Models.Properties.Parameters.ParameterSection.PropertyClass
member.summary: TYPE: Indicates, wether a is related to an individual's work place or to an individual's personal life. (2,3,4)

member.name: P:FolkerKinzel.VCards.Models.Properties.Parameters.ParameterSection.PropertyID
member.summary: PROP-ID: Identifies a property among all its siblings of the same property name. (4 - RFC 9554)
member.value: A valid value must be a of 1 and a maximum of 255 characters in size, and it MUST only contain the ASCII alphanumeric characters ("A-Za-z0-9"), hyphen (-), and underscore ("_").

remarks.para: (This is the property identification mechanism newly introduced with RFC 9554. The vCard 4.0 property identification is .)

This parameter uniquely identifies a among all of its siblings with the same name within a vCard. The identifier's only purpose is to uniquely identify siblings; its value has no other meaning. If an application makes use of , it SHOULD assign a unique identifier to each sibling of the same name within their embedding component. The same identifier MAY be used for properties of a different name, and it MAY also be assigned to a same-named property that is not a sibling.
Resolving duplicate identifier conflicts is specific to the application. Similarly, handling properties where some but not all siblings have a assigned is application-specific.

member.name: P:FolkerKinzel.VCards.Models.Properties.Parameters.ParameterSection.PropertyIDs
member.summary: PID: Gets the s used to identify the . (4)
member.remarks: The value of this property can change when calling the methods of the object provided by the property.

member.name: P:FolkerKinzel.VCards.Models.Properties.Parameters.ParameterSection.RelationType
member.summary: TYPE: Specifies the type of relationship with a person. (4)
member.remarks: Used in the VCard.Relations property (RELATED).

member.name: P:FolkerKinzel.VCards.Models.Properties.Parameters.ParameterSection.Script
member.summary: SCRIPT: Defines the script that a is written in. (4 - RFC 9554)
member.remarks: This parameter allows defining a script for a without also defining a language as the parameter would. The value MUST be a script subtag as defined in Section 2.2.3 of RFC 5646. The parameter is often used in combination with the parameter.

member.name: P:FolkerKinzel.VCards.Models.Properties.Parameters.ParameterSection.ServiceType
member.summary: SERVICE-TYPE: Defines the online service name associated with a messaging or social media profile. (4 - RFC 9554)
member.remarks: This parameter MAY be specified on a or a property to name the online service associated with that property value. Its value is case-sensitive.

member.name: P:FolkerKinzel.VCards.Models.Properties.Parameters.ParameterSection.SortAs
member.summary: SORT-AS: Determines the sort order. ([3],4)
member.value: s (case-sensitive!). Maximum as many as fields of the compound property.

example.code: FN:Rene van der Harten N;SORT-AS="Harten,Rene":van der Harten;Rene,J.;Sir;R.D.O.N.

member.remarks: When serializing a file as vCard 3.0, a separate SORT-STRING-property, which contains the first , is automatically inserted into the vCard.

s (stored in ) enable the global data synchronization mechanism introduced with vCard 4.0.

member.name: P:FolkerKinzel.VCards.VCardBuilder.FreeOrBusyUrls
member.summary: FBURL: Defines URLs that show when the person is "free" or "busy" on their calendar. (4, 3 - RFC 2739)
member.remarks: If several objects are assigned, the standard property is determined by the value of . URLs of the type FTP [RFC 1738] or HTTP [RFC 2616] refer to an iCalendar object [RFC 5545], which represents a snapshot of the next weeks or months with data for the busy time of the subject the represents. If the iCalendar object is a file, its file extension should be ".ifb".

member.name: P:FolkerKinzel.VCards.VCardBuilder.GenderViews

member.summary: GEO: Specifies latitudes and longitudes. (2,3,4)

remarks.note: This information can be connected directly with an object via its property in vCard 4.0.

member.name: P:FolkerKinzel.VCards.VCardBuilder.GramGenders
member.summary: GRAMGENDER: Defines which grammatical gender to use in salutations and other grammatical constructs. 4 - RFC 9554
member.remarks: This property defines the grammatical gender that the contact prefers to be addressed by or referred to as in written or spoken form. For example, the German language distinguishes by grammatical gender in salutations such as "Sehr geehrte" (feminine) and "Sehr geehrter" (masculine). Multiple occurrences of this property MUST be distinguished by the LANGUAGE parameter.

member.name: P:FolkerKinzel.VCards.VCardBuilder.NonStandards
member.summary: vCard-Properties that don't belong to the standard.

remarks.para: contains all vCard properties that could not be evaluated, when parsing the vCard. To serialize the content of into a VCF file, the flag has to be set.

Some objects are automatically added to the VCF file, if there is no standard equivalent for it. You can control this behavior with . It is therefore not recommended to assign objects with these s to this property.
These vCard properties are the following:

member.name: P:FolkerKinzel.VCards.VCardBuilder.Notes
member.summary: NOTE: Specifies supplemental informations or comments that are associated with the vCard. (2,3,4)

member.name: P:FolkerKinzel.VCards.VCardBuilder.Organizations
member.summary: ORG: The name and optionally the unit(s) of the organization associated with the vCard object. (2,3,4)

member.name: P:FolkerKinzel.VCards.VCardBuilder.OrgDirectories
member.summary: ORG-DIRECTORY: A URI representing the person's work place, which can be used to look up information on the person's co-workers. (RFC 6715)

member.name: P:FolkerKinzel.VCards.VCardBuilder.Phones
member.summary: TEL: Canonical number strings for a telephone numbers for telephony communication with the vCard object. (2,3,4)

member.name: P:FolkerKinzel.VCards.VCardBuilder.Photos
member.summary: PHOTO: Image(s) or photograph(s) of the individual associated with the vCard. (2,3,4)

member.name: P:FolkerKinzel.VCards.VCardBuilder.ProductID
member.summary: PRODID: The identifier for the product that created the vCard object. (3,4)
member.value: The name should be unique worldwide. It should therefore conform to the specification for Formal Public Identifiers [ISO 9070] or Universal Resource Names in RFC 3406.

member.name: P:FolkerKinzel.VCards.VCardBuilder.Profile
member.summary: PROFILE: States that the is a vCard. (3)

member.name: P:FolkerKinzel.VCards.VCardBuilder.Pronouns
member.summary: PRONOUNS: Defines the pronouns that shall be used to refer to the entity represented by this . (4 - RFC 9554)
member.remarks: This property contains the pronouns that the contact chooses to use for themselves. The value is free-form text. These pronouns shall be used when addressing or referring to the contact. Multiple occurrences of this property MAY define pronouns for multiple languages, preferences, and contexts. Multiple pronouns in the same language SHOULD use the parameter; otherwise, the order of preference is implementation-specific.

member.name: P:FolkerKinzel.VCards.VCardBuilder.Relations
member.summary: RELATED: Other entities that the person or organization is related to. (4)

member.name: P:FolkerKinzel.VCards.VCardBuilder.Roles
member.summary: ROLE: The role, occupation, or business category of the vCard object within an organization. (2,3,4)

member.name: P:FolkerKinzel.VCards.VCardBuilder.SocialMediaProfiles
member.summary: SOCIALPROFILE: Specifies the URI or username for social media profiles associated with the object the represents. (4 - RFC 9554)
member.value: A single URI or TEXT value. The default value type is URI.

remarks.para: In addition to the typical use of this property with URI values, it also allows setting usernames for social media services as free-text TEXT values, in which case the parameter MUST be provided.
The parameter MAY be assigned if the value type is URI.

member.name: P:FolkerKinzel.VCards.VCardBuilder.Sounds
member.summary: SOUND: Specifies the pronunciation of the property of the -object. (2,3,4)

member.name: P:FolkerKinzel.VCards.VCardBuilder.Sources
member.summary: SOURCE: URLs that can be used to get the latest version of this vCard. (3,4)
member.remarks: vCard 3.0 allows only one instance of this property.

member.name: P:FolkerKinzel.VCards.VCardBuilder.SpokenLanguages
member.summary: LANG: Defines languages that the person speaks. (4)

member.name: P:FolkerKinzel.VCards.VCardBuilder.TimeZones
member.summary: TZ: The time zone(s) of the vCard object. (2,3,4)

remarks.note: This information can be connected directly with an object via its property in vCard 4.0.

member.name: P:FolkerKinzel.VCards.VCardBuilder.Titles
member.summary: TITLE: Specifies the job title, functional position or function of the individual, associated with the vCard object, within an organization. (2,3,4)

member.remarks: With the flag is set. So this property is normally updated automatically when serializing VCF.

member.name: P:FolkerKinzel.VCards.VCardBuilder.Urls

member.name: P:FolkerKinzel.VCards.VCard.FreeOrBusyUrls
member.summary: FBURL: Defines URLs that show when the person is "free" or "busy" on their calendar. (4, 3 - RFC 2739)
member.remarks: If several objects are assigned, the standard property is determined by the value of . URLs of the type FTP [RFC 1738] or HTTP [RFC 2616] refer to an iCalendar object [RFC 5545], which represents a snapshot of the next weeks or months with data for the busy time of the subject the represents. If the iCalendar object is a file, its file extension should be ".ifb".

remarks.note: This information can be connected directly with an object via its property in vCard 4.0.

member.name: P:FolkerKinzel.VCards.VCard.GramGenders
member.summary: GRAMGENDER: Defines which grammatical gender to use in salutations and other grammatical constructs. 4 - RFC 9554
member.remarks: This property defines the grammatical gender that the contact prefers to be addressed by or referred to as in written or spoken form. For example, the German language distinguishes by grammatical gender in salutations such as "Sehr geehrte" (feminine) and "Sehr geehrter" (masculine). Multiple occurrences of this property MUST be distinguished by the LANGUAGE parameter.

member.name: P:FolkerKinzel.VCards.VCard.Messengers
member.summary: IMPP: Instant messenger handles. (3,4)
member.remarks: should specify a URI for instant messaging and presence protocol communications with the object the represents. If the URI can be used for voice and/or video, the property SHOULD be used in addition to this property.

member.name: P:FolkerKinzel.VCards.VCard.NameViews
member.summary: N: A structured representation of the name of the person, place or thing associated with the vCard object. (2,3,4)
member.remarks: Multiple instances are only allowed in vCard 4.0, and only if all of them have the same parameter. This can, e.g., be useful if the property is displayed in different languages.

member.name: P:FolkerKinzel.VCards.VCard.NickNames
member.summary: NICKNAME: One or more descriptive/familiar names for the object represented by this vCard. (3,4)

member.name: P:FolkerKinzel.VCards.VCard.NonStandards
member.summary: vCard-Properties that don't belong to the standard.

remarks.para: contains all vCard properties that could not be evaluated, when parsing the vCard. To serialize the content of into a VCF file, the flag has to be set.

Some objects are automatically added to the VCF file, if there is no standard equivalent for it. You can control this behavior with . It is therefore not recommended to assign objects with these s to this property.
These vCard properties are the following:

member.name: P:FolkerKinzel.VCards.VCard.Notes
member.summary: NOTE: Specifies supplemental informations or comments that are associated with the vCard. (2,3,4)

member.name: P:FolkerKinzel.VCards.VCard.Organizations
member.summary: ORG: The name and optionally the unit(s) of the organization associated with the vCard object. (2,3,4)

member.name: P:FolkerKinzel.VCards.VCard.OrgDirectories
member.summary: ORG-DIRECTORY: A URI representing the person's work place, which can be used to look up information on the person's co-workers. (RFC 6715)

member.name: P:FolkerKinzel.VCards.VCard.Phones
member.summary: TEL: Canonical number strings for a telephone numbers for telephony communication with the vCard object. (2,3,4)

member.name: P:FolkerKinzel.VCards.VCard.Photos
member.summary: PHOTO: Image(s) or photograph(s) of the individual associated with the vCard. (2,3,4)

member.name: P:FolkerKinzel.VCards.VCard.ProductID
member.summary: PRODID: The identifier for the product that created the vCard object. (3,4)
member.value: The name should be unique worldwide. It should therefore conform to the specification for Formal Public Identifiers [ISO 9070] or Universal Resource Names in RFC 3406.

member.name: P:FolkerKinzel.VCards.VCard.Profile
member.summary: PROFILE: States that the is a vCard. (3)

member.name: P:FolkerKinzel.VCards.VCard.Pronouns
member.summary: PRONOUNS: Defines the pronouns that shall be used to refer to the entity represented by this . (4 - RFC 9554)
member.remarks: This property contains the pronouns that the contact chooses to use for themselves. The value is free-form text. These pronouns shall be used when addressing or referring to the contact. Multiple occurrences of this property MAY define pronouns for multiple languages, preferences, and contexts. Multiple pronouns in the same language SHOULD use the parameter; otherwise, the order of preference is implementation-specific.

member.name: P:FolkerKinzel.VCards.VCard.Relations
member.summary: RELATED: Other entities that the person or organization is related to. (4)

member.name: P:FolkerKinzel.VCards.VCard.Roles
member.summary: ROLE: The role, occupation, or business category of the vCard object within an organization. (2,3,4)

member.name: P:FolkerKinzel.VCards.VCard.SocialMediaProfiles
member.summary: SOCIALPROFILE: Specifies the URI or username for social media profiles associated with the object the represents. (4 - RFC 9554)
member.value: A single URI or TEXT value. The default value type is URI.

remarks.para: In addition to the typical use of this property with URI values, it also allows setting usernames for social media services as free-text TEXT values, in which case the parameter MUST be provided.
The parameter MAY be assigned if the value type is URI.

member.name: P:FolkerKinzel.VCards.VCard.Sounds
member.summary: SOUND: Specifies the pronunciation of the property of the -object. (2,3,4)

member.name: P:FolkerKinzel.VCards.VCard.Sources
member.summary: SOURCE: URLs that can be used to get the latest version of this vCard. (3,4)
member.remarks: vCard 3.0 allows only one instance of this property.

member.name: P:FolkerKinzel.VCards.VCard.SpokenLanguages
member.summary: LANG: Defines languages that the person speaks. (4)

member.name: P:FolkerKinzel.VCards.VCard.TimeZones
member.summary: TZ: The time zone(s) of the vCard object. (2,3,4)

remarks.note: This information can be connected directly with an object via its property in vCard 4.0.

member.name: P:FolkerKinzel.VCards.VCard.Titles
member.summary: TITLE: Specifies the job title, functional position or function of the individual, associated with the vCard object, within an organization. (2,3,4)

member.name: P:FolkerKinzel.VCards.VCard.Updated
member.summary: REV: A time stamp for the last time the vCard was updated. (2,3,4)
member.remarks: With the flag is set. So this property is normally updated automatically when serializing VCF.

member.name: P:FolkerKinzel.VCards.VCard.Urls
member.summary: URL: URLs pointing to websites that represent the person in some way. (2,3,4)

member.name: P:FolkerKinzel.VCards.VCard.Xmls
member.summary: XML: Any XML data that is attached to the vCard. (4)
member.value: The instances may contain text that is valid XML. The root element must be explicitly assigned to an XML namespace (xmlns attribute). This namespace must not be the VCARD 4.0 namespace urn:ietf:params:xml:ns:vcard-4.0!

member.name: M:FolkerKinzel.VCards.VCard.NormalizeMembers
member.summary: Replaces instances in that contain text with instances that contain s.
member.remarks: RFC 6350 allows only URIs as value for MEMBER. Values that can't be preserved as URI will be saved in s and the Guids of these instances will be the content of MEMBER after .

member.name: M:FolkerKinzel.VCards.VCard.Reference(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{FolkerKinzel.VCards.VCard})
member.summary: Returns a collection of objects containing both, the objects passed as a collection as well as those which had been embedded in their property. The previously embedded objects are now referenced by objects that are initialized with the instance of the property of these previously embedded s.
member.param: A collection of objects. The collection may be empty or may contain null values.
member.returns: A collection of objects in which the objects previously embedded in the property are appended separately and referenced through their property. (If the appended objects did not already have a property, the method automatically assigns them a new one.)

remarks.note: Never use this method, if you want to save a VCF file as vCard 2.1 or vCard 3.0!
You can pass a single object to the method, since the class has an explicit implementation of IEnumerable<VCard>.
remarks.para: The method is - if necessary - automatically called by the serialization methods of . It only makes sense to use it in your own code, if a object is to be saved as vCard 4.0 and if each VCF file should only contain a single vCard. (As a rule, this approach is not advantageous as it endangers referential integrity.)

example.para: The example demonstrates how a object can be saved as a vCard 4.0 if it is intended that a VCF file should only contain one single vCard. The example may also show that this approach is generally not advantageous, as it endangers referential integrity.
The example uses the extension method , which calls .
example.note: For the sake of easier readability, exception handling has not been used in the example.

member.exception: is null.

The previously embedded objects are now referenced by objects that are initialized with the instance of the property of these previously embedded s.
member.param: A of instances to process.

member.summary: Replaces the instances that refer external vCards with their values by instances that contain these instances directly, provided that contains these instances.
member.param: A collection of objects. The collection may be empty or may contain null values.
member.returns: A collection of objects in which the s referenced by their property are embedded in objects, provided that contains these objects.

remarks.note: Although the method itself is thread-safe, the objects passed to the method are not. Block read and write access to these objects, while this method is being executed!
remarks.para: The method is automatically called by the deserialization methods of the class. Using it in your own code can be useful, e.g., if objects from different sources are combined in a common list in order to make their data searchable.

member.remarks: Call once before using any of the methods the object provides.

member.name: M:FolkerKinzel.VCards.VCard.RegisterApp(System.Uri)
member.summary: Registers the executing application with its global identifier.
member.param: An absolute that serves as global identifier of the executing application, or null to disable global synchronization. (The should be unique: UUID-URNs, e.g., are well suited.)

remarks.para: The registration of the executing application is a technical requirement for the global data synchronization mechanism introduced with vCard 4.0. Call this method once at the startup of the application: It's not allowed to register different s within a single application.
The method sets the static property .

Although it is allowed to call this method with the null argument, this is not recommended. (UUID-URNs are ideal for the task.) Call the method before any other method of the library and only once in the lifetime of your application. The URI should be the same everytime the application runs.

member.exception: is not an absolute .

the class had been used before this method has been called.

Options for writing the VCF file. The flags can be combined.
An object that implements to convert IANA time zone names to UTC offsets, or null.

remarks.note: Although the method itself is thread-safe, the objects passed to the method are not. Block read and write access to these objects, while this method is being executed!
remarks.para: The method may serialize more vCards than were originally elements in the argument . This happens when a VCF file is saved as vCard 4.0 and when in the properties or of a object further VCard objects can be found.
In the same way the method behaves, if a vCard 2.1 or 3.0 is serialized with the option and if in the property of a VCard object an instance is located on whose parameter the flag is set.
